October 5, 1939
Mr. Frank 9£. Schooley
Radio Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
Please accept my thanks for your letter of
October 2 with its comments on the report on ’’Central Sound
Systems for Schools”. Your comments were exactly of the
specific type which are most helpful.
In a letter which I received today from the
Federal Recorder Company, there is the following paragraph:
”As I mentioned over the telephone, we found ourselves
unable to establish connections with the N.A.E.B., in
order to have tests made of our equipment. At the time
tests were being conducted, we were unfortunately in the
process of changing models, and at the same time, we were
changing the location of our manufacturing plant. For
that reason, you will find that on Page 34, our models are
now listed with incorrect prices and model names.”
I shall appreciate it if you will let me know
er that is a correct statement of the situation with
ct to the Federal Recorder.
Sincerely yours.
Irvin Stewart,
Director
